intro: Dombeya ambongensis subsp. sakarahae, commonly known as the Sakaraha dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is shrub-like, with hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
